    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static ABT getInstance()
        DO NOT USE THIS METHOD! ABT requires an application Context to do any kind of data persistence or networking. This is only used internally when there is no direct handle to such a Context, at which point it can be assumed that the Context was already supplied to the singleton via getInstance(Context context) or setContext(Context context).

      • getInstance

        public static ABT getInstance(Context context)
        Initialize this library with the application Context and get the singleton instance for ABT

        Initialize this library with the application Context without getting an instance of ABT

      • getSelectedBible

        public Bible getSelectedBible(java.lang.String tag)
        An instance of a Bible is often required to download Verse data. The user-selected Bible can be stored and loaded at a later time. Multiple Bibles can be saved at the same time by specifying a tag. This method loads the Bible that has been stored with the specified tag.
        Parameters:
        tag - unique tag that identified this instance of a Bible to persist
        Returns:
        Generic Bible object representing the Bible that was stored. It maintains the same Type of the object that was saved

      • getSelectedBibleType

        public java.lang.Class<? extends Bible> getSelectedBibleType(java.lang.String tag)
        An instance of a Bible is often required to download Verse data. The user-selected Bible can be stored and loaded at a later time. Multiple Bibles can be saved at the same time by specifying a tag. This method returns the Class representing the Bible that has been stored with the specified key.
        Parameters:
        tag - unique tag that identified this instance of a Bible to persist
        Returns:
        Class object representing the type of Bible that was stored

      • setSelectedBible

        public void setSelectedBible(Bible bible,
                             java.lang.String tag)
        An instance of a Bible is often required to download Verse data. The user-selected Bible can be stored and loaded at a later time. Multiple Bibles can be saved at the same time by specifying a tag. This method saves a Bible to be loaded later.

        The Bible's Type is saved along with the result of Bible.serialize() so that any generic Bible subclass can fully save and load whatever data is necessary in whatever format. All serialization and deserialization is left entirely up to the Bible class.

        Parameters:
        tag - unique tag that identified this instance of a Bible to persist
